website_summaries.verdict: Zamberlan did not fail to please in terms of comfort, fit and waterproofing with the 1025 Tofane NW GT RR. These features were admired and positively received by outdoorsmen, making them appreciate the price they paid for it.However, it was not able to convince everyone. As a whole, despite its unsatisfactory points, the Zamberlan 1025 Tofane NW GT RR is still a pair of backpacking boots that has a lot to offer on every adventure.
pros: The majority raved about the comfortable feel of the 1025 Tofane NW GT RR
It fits like a glove, according to numerous wearers
Umpteen hikers mentioned that despite its ultra-high price, this backpacking boot was all worth the money spent
The excellent craftsmanship of the Zamberlan 1025 Tofane NW GT RR received praises from loads of users
A great deal of owners recommended it for use in winter
Surprisingly, breaking it in was not necessary at all, based on plenty of customer reviews
Some backpackers lauded the effective waterproofing of the boot
cons: A couple of hikers stated that they felt pain in the heel area after covering a few miles
A user disliked that scratches were easily noticeable on the Tofane NW GT RR from Zamberlan

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy boots
customer_reviews.text: The price of these boots is twice as much as the best boots I have bought before. I bought the boots because a friend highly recommended them. My friend also recommended that I put in Superfeet Green Support and Comfort Insoles, and I did. I have worn them 4 times hiking over 15 miles each time. The first couple times, I felt the boots to be too rigid. The rigidity improved but still not as comfortable as my other boots. I'm hoping that they will fit better after several more uses. However, I have to say that they are really sturdy and protective of my ankles. So, I will recommend them to those who want better protection of their feet.
customer_reviews.author: Yee H Shuai

customer_reviews.title: Modern Classic
customer_reviews.text: Modern features with a classic welted sole. A very high quality boot. Every shoe and boot I own is a size 13. These boots in size 13 are EU size 48 which is larger than a typical size 13. I had to go with a size 12 (47) for a good fit. The stitching behind the heel seems to be less than ideal. See pictures...
customer_reviews.author: TechJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable Boot - Ever!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are as comfortable as they are hansom. They fit the foot perfectly, provide excellent support and they are light weight, I also notice a reduction in shock waves during walks on hard surfaces. I can't say enough good things about the fit and how well they feel. The foot stays nice and warm, but doesn't get hot. Just right. For context, the two boots I used before and liked were the Asolo TPS 535, which is a very good boot and the Zamberlan Vioz GT, whic si also good but not as much as the Asolo. This model is far superior to both and well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dan and TalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on lesser boots, these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: they do need to broken in my opinion. I ...
customer_reviews.text: they do need to broken in my opinion. I wore mine for about 10 miles of walking before they felt broken in.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK P. BENINATO

customer_reviews.title: **Sole Fail**
customer_reviews.text: Hiking down the Pueblo Mountains I had the sole blow out and come unglued? This is a bizarre failure that a $470 boot just should not experience. I've taken meticulous care of these boots, cleaning after each use and treating with Hydrobloc, etc. Contacting Zamberlan to see what to do next.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Only The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Zamberlan's best! I always wear boots for several days in the house. Buy the recommended wax and keep them clean. Don't think you can wear a pair out.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Mccandless

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking boots on the market. Period!
customer_reviews.text: I hike a lot. This is the best pair of hiking boots I have ever owned. Soft but sturdy leather, very comfortable and stylish as well. Italians are the BEST in this business. They earned their reputation. The price of this pair is high, but this grand opus is worth every penny of it.
customer_reviews.author: Isik Kanik

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Boot!
customer_reviews.text: This boot was recommended to my husband by his podiatrist for arch support and relief of a hammertoe condition due to arthritis. The fit and comfort was great with his orthotics, but he needed a taller boot shaft due to working in cultivated ground conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha P.

customer_reviews.title: Simply the highest quality
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Zamberlan's. No they don't wear out that fast. My dog Rocket got my first pair. Bad dog! These are even more comfortable than my first pair and there was virtually no break in. Love the old fashioned design you can put crampons on it if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Arvada

customer_reviews.title: Buy these boots
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased racks of boots over the years and these are the best by far. Although the leather is stiff to start, the fit and finish are perfection and the leather softens quickly to melt onto your feet. I've got hard to fit feet [wide] and these are awesome. My wife and daughter both complimented me on the look of these boots, which are handsome and classic. Perfect purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Keith & Holly

customer_reviews.title: The best pair of boots I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: The best pair of boots I have ever had, the quality is seen throughout. I had an original pair of Iditarod boots from Timberland and these boots are made much better than those and at the time I thought those boots were the best I ever had. I did go up a half size and the boots were great right out of the box. I also like the way the boot rocks from the toe back, sign of a quality made boot. Very satisfied, can't wait for my Colorado trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best construction boot I have worn
customer_reviews.text: U use this boot for hiking and hunting. Best boot for support i have had. not too stiff great to walk in. Great leather.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J.

customer_reviews.title: These fit perfect. Took all of two short hikes to break ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 E. These fit perfect. Took all of two short hikes to break in. I don't want to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Ramazon sucks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this boots really confortable, leather really thick, I’m pretty sure that I’m going to have boot for years.
customer_reviews.author: Reynier

customer_reviews.title: I need to order size 9 wide. The only option is Medium. Please help me order size 9 wide.
customer_reviews.text: Wish to order this boot same length but wider. Please help me buy the Zamberlan Tofane wax brick. 9 wider
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lorch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot
customer_reviews.text: Boots arrived in perfect condition and met my quality expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: VERY good, however a little wide for my narrow foot.Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: Had the boots for only a few days but already feel these are some of the best boots I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Duchon

customer_reviews.title: What a great boot! I put them on the day that ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great boot! I put them on the day that I received them and went for a 5 mile hike and I had no blisters. Additional I have been wearing these boots everyday for the last week to work because they are just so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brannan

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my feet
customer_reviews.text: Boots fit but my heals hurts after wearing them. For spending close to 500.00 these should be perfect
customer_reviews.author: RealDeal

customer_reviews.title: Quality, pretty much sums it up
customer_reviews.text: Extremely build quality and exceptional attention to detail, I have a few well made hiking name brand boots but none of them come close to these boots, the break in easily and are comfortable, You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: They need to improve the soles on these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I have the slightly taller, and slightly more expensive version of this boot called the "Sella". For a $500+ dollar boot, they should last for years without issue. However, at less than 4 years, the soles are wearing out, and a chunk fell out of one sole of one of the boots. These are $500 boots at $250 quality. This boot company needs to go to a MUCH sturdier, older style Vibram sole that doesn't just fall apart after a few short years. These boots SHOULD last 30 years, but at this rate, I am going to wonder if they make 10.
customer_reviews.author: SomeRandomAmazonPurchaser

customer_reviews.title: When I first put them on and walked it felt like my feet were being propelled on their own
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about a year ago from Planet Shoes. Honestly I don't put them through as rough conditions as some of the reviews here, but my hikes through the desert here in Arizona sure have become easier. When I first put them on and walked it felt like my feet were being propelled on their own; their is a very natural rotation from heel plant to toe lift. Having said that, these are not your light hikers and the weight is very noticeable especially on my 5 - 10 mile hikes. Have no complaints thus far and am perfectly delighted with the construction and materials. Will be buried with these on my feet...
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Best boot ever for hiking. I had a similar Zamberlan pair I bought almost 20 years ago and they are still great after many years of hiking, but the leather has faded and the soles are starting to lose the tread. The new pair fits great and has the same rock solid stability as the previous pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable boot, but I am very disappointed with the quality. The sole on one boot delaminated after only 425km of hiking, requiring a resole (of both boots so that they match). I have had other hiking boots of supposed lower quality last much better than that. Very disappointing for boots that cost $400 on sale - just because they can be resoled doesn't mean you should have to after only a short period.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy these boots be sure to read all ...
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy these boots be sure to read all of the reviews, and take notice on how many of the reviews are by "verified" purchasers. It makes me wonder when only "7" out of "14" are "verified" purchasers. The grammar used in the reviews makes me think the reviews are being translated. I think the reviews were written by one person, "2" out of the "14" reviews the people said the boots were worn over lava, how many people have worn boots over lava??? Not that it can't be done, but "never" have I read about someone wearing their boots over lava, and here "2" out of "14" people have???
customer_reviews.author: William L.

product_meta.title: Zamberlan mens 1025WB Tofane Nw Gt Rr Brown Size:
feature_bullets: The H on label refers to half, for ex. 10H refers to 10.5
